ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: A boolean indicating if a visitor is new or returning. Possible values: New Visitor, Returning Visitor.

The visit index for a visitor to your property. Each visit from a unique visitor will get its own incremental index starting from 1 for the first visit. Subsequent visits do not change previous visit indicies. For example, if a certain visitor has 4 visits to your website, visitCount for that visitor will have 4 distinct values of 1 through 4.
The number of days elapsed since visitors last visited your property. Used to calculate visitor loyalty.
The value provided when you define custom visitor segments for your property.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: Total number of visitors to your property for the requested time period.
The number of visitors whose visit to your property was marked as a first-time visit.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The percentage of visits by people who had never visited your property before. (ga:newVisits / ga:visits )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The length of a visit to your property measured in seconds and reported in second increments. The value returned is a string.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: Counts the total number of sessions.
The total number of single page (or single engagement hit) sessions for your property.
The total duration of visitor sessions represented in total seconds.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The percentage of single-page visits (i.e., visits in which the person left your property from the first page). (ga:bounces / ga:visits )
The average duration visitor sessions represented in total seconds. (ga:timeOnSite / ga:visits )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The path of the referring URL (e.g. document.referrer). If someone places a link to your property on their website, this element contains the path of the page that contains the referring link.
The full referring URL including the hostname and path.

When using manual campaign tracking, the value of the utm_campaign campaign tracking parameter. When using AdWords autotagging, the name(s) of the online ad campaign that you use for your property. Otherwise the value (not set) is used.

The source of referrals to your property. When using manual campaign tracking, the value of the utm_source campaign tracking parameter. When using AdWords autotagging, the value is google. Otherwise the domain of the source referring the visitor to your property (e.g. document.referrer). The value may also contain a port address. If the visitor arrived without a referrer, the value is (direct)

The type of referrals to your property. When using manual campaign tracking, the value of the utm_medium campaign tracking parameter. When using AdWords autotagging, the value is ppc. If the user comes from a search engine detected by Google Analytics, the value is organic. If the referrer is not a search engine, the value is referral. If the visitor came directly to the property, and document.referrer is empty, the value is (none).
Combined values of ga:source and ga:medium.

When using manual campaign tracking, the value of the utm_term campaign tracking parameter. When using AdWords autotagging or if a visitor used organic search to reach your property, the keywords used by visitors to reach your property. Otherwise the value is (not set).

When using manual campaign tracking, the value of the utm_content campaign tracking parameter. When using AdWords autotagging, the first line of the text for your online Ad campaign. If you are using mad libs for your AdWords content, this field displays the keywords you provided for the mad libs keyword match. Otherwise the value is (not set)
Name of the social network. This can be related to the referring social network for traffic sources, or to the social network for social data hub activities. E.g. Google+, Blogger, etc.
Indicates visits that arrived to the property from a social source. The possible values are Yes or No where the first letter is capitalized.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The number of organic searches that happened within a session. This metric is search engine agnostic.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The name of your AdWords ad group.
The location of the advertisement on the hosting page (Top, RHS, or not set).
The ad slot positions in which your AdWords ads appeared (1-8).
The networks used to deliver your ads (Content, Search, Search partners, etc.).

The match types applied for the search term the user had input(Phrase, Exact, Broad, etc.). Ads on the content network are identified as Content network. Details: https://support.google.com/adwords/answer/2472708?hl=en
The match types applied to your keywords (Phrase, Exact, Broad). Details: https://support.google.com/adwords/answer/2472708?hl=en
The search queries that triggered impressions of your AdWords ads.
The domains where your ads on the content network were placed.
The URLs where your ads on the content network were placed.
Your AdWords ad formats (Text, Image, Flash, Video, etc.).
How your AdWords ads were targeted (keyword, placement, and vertical targeting, etc.).
How you manage your ads on the content network. Values are Automatic placements or Managed placements.
The URLs your AdWords ads displayed.
The URLs to which your AdWords ads referred traffic.
A string. Corresponds to AdWords API AccountInfo.customerId.
A string. Corresponds to AdWords API Campaign.id.
A string. Corresponds to AdWords API AdGroup.id.
A string. Corresponds to AdWords API Ad.id.
A string. Corresponds to AdWords API Criterion.id.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: Total number of campaign impressions.
The total number of times users have clicked on an ad to reach your property.
Derived cost for the advertising campaign. The currency for this value is based on the currency that you set in your AdWords account.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: Cost per thousand impressions. (ga:adCost / (ga:impressions / 1000) )
Cost to advertiser per click. (ga:adCost / ga:adClicks )

Click-through-rate for your ad. This is equal to the number of clicks divided by the number of impressions for your ad (e.g. how many times users clicked on one of your ads where that ad appeared). (ga:adClicks / ga:impressions )
The cost per transaction for your property. ((ga:adCost) / (ga:transactions) )
The cost per goal conversion for your property. ((ga:adCost) / (ga:goalCompletionsAll) )
The cost per conversion (including ecommerce and goal conversions) for your property. ((ga:adCost) / (ga:transactions + ga:goalCompletionsAll) )

RPC or revenue-per-click is the average revenue (from ecommerce sales and/or goal value) you received for each click on one of your search ads. ((ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll) / ga:adClicks )
Returns on Investment is overall transaction profit divided by derived advertising cost. ((ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll - ga:adCost) / ga:adCost )
The overall transaction profit margin. ((ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll - ga:adCost) / (ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll) )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The page path or screen name that matched any destination type goal completion.
The page path or screen name that matched any destination type goal, one step prior to the goal completion location.
The page path or screen name that matched any destination type goal, two steps prior to the goal completion location.
The page path or screen name that matched any destination type goal, three steps prior to the goal completion location.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of starts for the requested goal number.
The total number of starts for all goals defined for your profile.
The total number of completions for the requested goal number.
The total number of completions for all goals defined for your profile.
The total numeric value for the requested goal number.
The total numeric value for all goals defined for your profile.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average goal value of a visit to your property. ((ga:goalValueAll / ga:visits) )
The percentage of visits which resulted in a conversion to the requested goal number. (ga:goalXXCompletions / ga:visits )
The percentage of visits which resulted in a conversion to at least one of your goals. (ga:goalCompletionsAll / ga:visits )
The number of times visitors started conversion activity on the requested goal number without actually completing it. ((ga:goalXXStarts - ga:goalXXCompletions) )
The overall number of times visitors started goals without actually completing them. ((ga:goalStartsAll - ga:goalCompletionsAll) )
The rate at which the requested goal number was abandoned. (((ga:goalXXStarts - ga:goalXXCompletions)) / (ga:goalXXStarts) )
The rate at which goals were abandoned. (((ga:goalStartsAll - ga:goalCompletionsAll)) / (ga:goalStartsAll) )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The names of browsers used by visitors to your website. For example, Internet Explorer or Firefox.
The browser versions used by visitors to your website. For example, 2.0.0.14
The operating system used by your visitors. For example, Windows, Linux , Macintosh, iPhone, iPod.
The version of the operating system used by your visitors, such as XP for Windows or PPC for Macintosh.
Mobile manufacturer or branded name.
Mobile device model
Selector used on the mobile device (e.g.: touchscreen, joystick, clickwheel, stylus).
The branding, model, and marketing name used to identify the mobile device.
The marketing name used for the mobile device.
The type of device: desktop, tablet, or mobile.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The continents of property visitors, derived from IP addresses.
The sub-continent of visitors, derived from IP addresses. For example, Polynesia or Northern Europe.
The countries of website visitors, derived from IP addresses.
The region of visitors to your property, derived from IP addresses. In the U.S., a region is a state, such as New York.
The Designated Market Area (DMA) from where traffic arrived on your property.
The cities of property visitors, derived from IP addresses.
The approximate latitude of the visitors city. Derived from IP address. Locations north of the equator are represented by positive values and locations south of the equator by negative values.
The approximate longitude of the visitors city. Derived from IP address. Locations east of the meridian are represented by positive values and locations west of the meridian by negative values.
The domain name of the ISPs used by visitors to your property. This is derived from the domain name registered to the IP address.

The name of service providers used to reach your property. For example, if most visitors to your website come via the major service providers for cable internet, you will see the names of those cable service providers in this element.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The versions of Flash supported by visitors browsers, including minor versions.
Indicates Java support for visitors browsers. The possible values are Yes or No where the first letter must be capitalized.
The language provided by the HTTP Request for the browser. Values are given as an ISO-639 code (e.g. en-gb for British English).
The color depth of visitors monitors, as retrieved from the DOM of the visitors browser. For example 4-bit, 8-bit, 24-bit, or undefined-bit.
The screen resolution of visitors monitors, as retrieved from the DOM of the visitors browser. For example: 1024x738.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: For a social data hub activity, this value represents the URL of the social activity (e.g. the Google+ post URL, the blog comment URL, etc.)
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the title of the social activity posted by the social network user.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the content of the social activity posted by the social network user (e.g. The message content of a Google+ post)
For a social data hub activity, this value represents when the social activity occurred on the social network.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the social network handle (e.g. name or ID) of the user who initiated the social activity.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the URL of the photo associated with the users social network profile.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the URL of the associated users social network profile.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the URL shared by the associated social network user.
For a social data hub activity, this is a comma-separated set of tags associated with the social activity.
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the type of social action associated with the activity (e.g. vote, comment, +1, etc.).
For a social data hub activity, this value represents the type of social action and the social network where the activity originated.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The count of activities where a content URL was shared / mentioned on a social data hub partner network.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The hostname from which the tracking request was made.
A page on your website specified by path and/or query parameters. Use in conjunction with hostname to get the full URL of the page.
This dimension rolls up all the page paths in the first hierarchical level in pagePath.
This dimension rolls up all the page paths in the second hierarchical level in pagePath.
This dimension rolls up all the page paths in the third hierarchical level in pagePath.
This dimension rolls up all the page paths into hierarchical levels. Up to 4 pagePath levels maybe specified. All additional levels in the pagePath hierarchy are also rolled up in this dimension.
The title of a page. Keep in mind that multiple pages might have the same page title.
The first page in a users session, or landing page.
The second page in a users session.
The last page in a users session, or exit page.
A page on your property that was visited before another page on the same property. Typically used with the pagePath dimension.
A page on your website that was visited after another page on your website. Typically used with the previousPagePath dimension.

The number of pages visited by visitors during a session (visit). The value is a histogram that counts pageviews across a range of possible values. In this calculation, all visits will have at least one pageview, and some percentage of visits will have more.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The average value of this page or set of pages. Page Value is (ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll) / ga:uniquePageviews (for the page or set of pages).
The number of entrances to your property measured as the first pageview in a session. Typically used with landingPagePath
The total number of pageviews for your property.
The number of different (unique) pages within a session. This takes into both the pagePath and pageTitle to determine uniqueness.

How long a visitor spent on a particular page in seconds. Calculated by subtracting the initial view time for a particular page from the initial view time for a subsequent page. Thus, this metric does not apply to exit pages for your property.
The number of exits from your property.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The percentage of pageviews in which this page was the entrance. (ga:entrances / ga:pageviews )
The average number of pages viewed during a visit to your property. Repeated views of a single page are counted. (ga:pageviews / ga:visits )
The average amount of time visitors spent viewing this page or a set of pages. (ga:timeOnPage / (ga:pageviews - ga:exits) )
The percentage of exits from your property that occurred out of the total page views. (ga:exits / (ga:pageviews + ga:screenviews) )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: A boolean to distinguish whether internal search was used in a session. Values are Visits With Site Search and Visits Without Site Search.
Search terms used by visitors within your property.
Subsequent keyword search terms or strings entered by users after a given initial string search.
The categories used for the internal search if you have this enabled for your profile. For example, you might have product categories such as electronics, furniture, or clothing.
A page where the user initiated an internal search on your property.
A page that the user visited after performing an internal search on your property.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The number of times a search result page was viewed after performing a search.
The total number of unique keywords from internal searches within a session. For example if shoes was searched for 3 times in a session, it will be only counted once.
The total number of sessions that included an internal search
The average number of subsequent page views made on your property after a use of your internal search feature.

The total number of times a refinement (transition) occurs between internal search keywords within a session. For example if the sequence of keywords is: shoes, shoes, pants, pants, this metric will be one because the transition between shoes and pants is different.
The visit duration to your property where a use of your internal search feature occurred.
The number of exits on your site that occurred following a search result from your internal search feature.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average number of times people viewed a search results page after performing a search. (ga:searchResultViews / ga:searchUniques )
The percentage of visits with search. (ga:searchVisits / ga:visits )
The average number of pages people viewed after performing a search on your property. (ga:searchDepth / ga:searchUniques )
The percentage of number of times a refinement (i.e., transition) occurs between internal search keywords within a session. (ga:searchRefinements / ga:searchResultViews )
The average amount of time people spent on your property after searching. (ga:searchDuration / ga:searchUniques )
The percentage of searches that resulted in an immediate exit from your property. (ga:searchExits / ga:searchUniques )
The percentage of search visits (i.e., visits that included at least one search) which resulted in a conversion to the requested goal number. (ga:goalXXCompletions / ga:searchUniques )
The percentage of search visits (i.e., visits that included at least one search) which resulted in a conversion to at least one of your goals. (ga:goalCompletionsAll / ga:searchUniques )
The average goal value of a search on your property. (ga:goalValueAll / ga:searchUniques )

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: Total Page Load Time is the amount of time (in milliseconds) it takes for pages from the sample set to load, from initiation of the pageview (e.g. click on a page link) to load completion in the browser.
The sample set (or count) of pageviews used to calculate the average page load time.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) spent in DNS lookup for this page among all samples.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) to download this page among all samples.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) spent in redirects before fetching this page among all samples. If there are no redirects, the value for this metric is expected to be 0.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) spent in establishing TCP connection for this page among all samples.
The total amount of time (in milliseconds) your server takes to respond to a user request among all samples, including the network time from users location to your server.

The sample set (or count) of pageviews used to calculate the averages for site speed metrics. This metric is used in all site speed average calculations including avgDomainLookupTime, avgPageDownloadTime, avgRedirectionTime, avgServerConnectionTime, and avgServerResponseTime.

The time the browser takes (in milliseconds) to parse the document (DOMInteractive), including the network time from the users location to your server. At this time, the user can interact with the Document Object Model even though it is not fully loaded.

The time the browser takes (in milliseconds) to parse the document and execute deferred and parser-inserted scripts (DOMContentLoaded), including the network time from the users location to your server. Parsing of the document is finished, the Document Object Model is ready, but referenced style sheets, images, and subframes may not be finished loading. This event is often the starting point for javascript framework execution, e.g., JQuerys onready() callback, etc.
The sample set (or count) of pageviews used to calculate the averages for site speed DOM metrics. This metric is used in the avgDomContentLoadedTime and avgDomInteractiveTime calculations.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average amount of time (in seconds) it takes for pages from the sample set to load, from initiation of the pageview (e.g. click on a page link) to load completion in the browser. ((ga:pageLoadTime / ga:pageLoadSample / 1000) )
The average amount of time (in seconds) spent in DNS lookup for this page. ((ga:domainLookupTime / ga:speedMetricsSample / 1000) )
The average amount of time (in seconds) to download this page. ((ga:pageDownloadTime / ga:speedMetricsSample / 1000) )

The average amount of time (in seconds) spent in redirects before fetching this page. If there are no redirects, the value for this metric is expected to be 0. ((ga:redirectionTime / ga:speedMetricsSample / 1000) )
The average amount of time (in seconds) spent in establishing TCP connection for this page. ((ga:serverConnectionTime / ga:speedMetricsSample / 1000) )

The average amount of time (in seconds) your server takes to respond to a user request, including the network time from users location to your server. ((ga:serverResponseTime / ga:speedMetricsSample / 1000) )

The average time (in seconds) it takes the browser to parse the document and execute deferred and parser-inserted scripts including the network time from the users location to your server. ((ga:domInteractiveTime / ga:domLatencyMetricsSample / 1000) )
The average time (in seconds) it takes the browser to parse the document. ((ga:domContentLoadedTime / ga:domLatencyMetricsSample / 1000) )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: ID of the installer (e.g., Google Play Store) from which the app was downloaded. By default, the app installer id is set based on the PackageManager#getInstallerPackageName method.
The version of the application.
The name of the application.
The ID of the application.
The name of the screen.
The number of screenviews per session reported as a string. Can be useful for historgrams.
The name of the first screen viewed.
The name of the screen when the user exited the application.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of screenviews.
The number of different (unique) screenviews within a session.
The time spent viewing the current screen.
The average amount of time users spent on a screen in seconds.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average number of screenviews per session. (ga:screenviews / ga:visits )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The category of the event.
The action of the event.
The label of the event.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of events for the profile, across all categories.
The total number of unique events for the profile, across all categories.
The total value of events for the profile.
The total number of visits with events.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average value of an event. (ga:eventValue / ga:totalEvents )
The average number of events per visit with event. (ga:totalEvents / ga:visitsWithEvent )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The transaction ID for the shopping cart purchase as supplied by your ecommerce tracking method.
Typically used to designate a supplying company or brick and mortar location; product affiliation.
The number of visits between users purchases and the related campaigns that lead to the purchases.
The number of days between users purchases and the related campaigns that lead to the purchases.
The product sku for purchased items as you have defined them in your ecommerce tracking application.
The product name for purchased items as supplied by your ecommerce tracking application.
Any product variations (size, color) for purchased items as supplied by your ecommerce application.
The local currency code of the transaction based on ISO 4217 standard.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of transactions.
The total sale revenue provided in the transaction excluding shipping and tax.
The total cost of shipping.
The total amount of tax.
The total number of items purchased. For example, if users purchase 2 frisbees and 5 tennis balls, 7 items have been purchased.
The number of product sets purchased. For example, if users purchase 2 frisbees and 5 tennis balls from your site, 2 unique products have been purchased.
The total revenue from purchased product items on your property.
Transaction revenue in local currency.
Transaction shipping cost in local currency.
Transaction tax in local currency.
Product revenue in local currency.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average number of transactions for a visit to your property. (ga:transactions / ga:visits )
The average revenue for an e-commerce transaction. (ga:transactionRevenue / ga:transactions )
Average transaction revenue for a visit to your property. (ga:transactionRevenue / ga:visits )
Total value for your property (including total revenue and total goal value). ((ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll) )
The average revenue per item. (ga:itemRevenue / ga:itemQuantity )
The average quantity of this item (or group of items) sold per purchase. (ga:itemQuantity / ga:uniquePurchases )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: For social interactions, a value representing the social network being tracked.
For social interactions, a value representing the social action being tracked (e.g. +1, bookmark)
For social interactions, a value representing the concatenation of the socialInteractionNetwork and socialInteractionAction action being tracked at this hit level (e.g. Google: +1)
For social interactions, a value representing the URL (or resource) which receives the social network action.
Engagement type. Possible values are Socially Engaged or Not Socially Engaged.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of social interactions on your property.

The number of sessions during which the specified social action(s) occurred at least once. This is based on the the unique combination of socialInteractionNetwork, socialInteractionAction, and socialInteractionTarget.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The number of social interactions per visit to your property. (ga:socialInteractions / ga:uniqueSocialInteractions )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: A string for categorizing all user timing variables into logical groups for easier reporting purposes.
The name of the resources action being tracked.
A value that can be used to add flexibility in visualizing user timings in the reports.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total number of milliseconds for a user timing.
The number of hits that were sent for a particular userTimingCategory, userTimingLabel, and userTimingVariable.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The average amount of elapsed time. ((ga:userTimingValue / ga:userTimingSample / 1000) )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The description for the exception.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The number of exceptions that were sent to Google Analytics.
The number of exceptions where isFatal is set to true.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The number of exceptions thrown divided by the number of screenviews. (ga:exceptions / ga:screenviews )
The number of fatal exceptions thrown divided by the number of screenviews. (ga:fatalExceptions / ga:screenviews )

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The visitor-scoped id of the content experiment that the user was exposed to when the metrics were reported.
The visitor-scoped id of the particular variation that the user was exposed to during a content experiment.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The name of the requested custom dimension, where XX refers the number/index of the custom dimension.
The name for the requested custom variable.
The value for the requested custom variable.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The name of the requested custom metric, where XX refers the number/index of the custom metric.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: The date of the visit formatted as YYYYMMDD.
The year of the visit. A four-digit year from 2005 to the current year.
The month of the visit. A two digit integer from 01 to 12.
The week of the visit. A two-digit number from 01 to 53. Each week starts on Sunday.
The day of the month. A two-digit number from 01 to 31.

A two-digit hour of the day ranging from 00-23 in the timezone configured for the account. This value is also corrected for daylight savings time, adhering to all local rules for daylight savings time. If your timezone follows daylight savings time, there will be an apparent bump in the number of visits during the change-over hour (e.g. between 1:00 and 2:00) for the day per year when that hour repeats. A corresponding hour with zero visits will occur at the opposite changeover. (Google Analytics does not track visitor time more precisely than hours.)
Returns the minute in the hour. The possible values are between 00 and 59.
Index for each month in the specified date range. Index for the first month in the date range is 0, 1 for the second month, and so on. The index corresponds to month entries.
Index for each week in the specified date range. Index for the first week in the date range is 0, 1 for the second week, and so on. The index corresponds to week entries.
Index for each day in the specified date range. Index for the first day (i.e., start-date) in the date range is 0, 1 for the second day, and so on.
Index for each minute in the specified date range. Index for the first minute of first day (i.e., start-date) in the date range is 0, 1 for the next minute, and so on.
The day of the week. A one-digit number from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).
The name of the day of the week (in English).
Combined values of ga:date and ga:hour.
Combined values of ga:year and ga:month.
Combined values of ga:year and ga:week.

The ISO week number, where each week starts with a Monday. Details: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_week_date . ga:isoWeek should only be used with ga:isoYear since ga:year represents gregorian calendar.
The ISO year of the visit. Details: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_week_date . ga:isoYear should only be used with ga:isoWeek since ga:week represents gregorian calendar.
Combined values of ga:isoYear and ga:isoWeek.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: Age bracket of visitor.
Gender of visitor.
Indicates that users are more likely to be interested in learning about the specified category, and more likely to be ready to purchase.
Indicates that users are more likely to be interested in learning about the specified category.
Indicates that users are more likely to be ready to purchase products or services in the specified category.

ItemType.Name: Dimensions
ItemType.DataItem: Age bracket of visitor.
Gender of visitor.
Indicates that users are more likely to be interested in learning about the specified category, and more likely to be ready to purchase.
Indicates that users are more likely to be interested in learning about the specified category.
Indicates that users are more likely to be ready to purchase products or services in the specified category.

ItemType.Name: Metrics
ItemType.DataItem: The total revenue from AdSense ads.
The number of AdSense ad units viewed. An Ad unit is a set of ads displayed as a result of one piece of the AdSense ad code. Details: https://support.google.com/adsense/answer/32715?hl=en
The number of AdSense ads viewed. Multiple ads can be displayed within an Ad Unit.
The number of times AdSense ads on your site were clicked.
The number of pageviews during which an AdSense ad was displayed. A page impression can have multiple Ad Units.
The number of sessions that ended due to a user clicking on an AdSense ad.

ItemType.Name: Calculated
ItemType.DataItem: The percentage of page impressions that resulted in a click on an AdSense ad. (ga:adsenseAdsClicks/ga:adsensePageImpressions )
The estimated cost per thousand page impressions. It is your AdSense Revenue per 1000 page impressions. (ga:adsenseRevenue/(ga:adsensePageImpressions/1000) )
